Title: LNG floating storage accumulation grows to unprecedented levels near Gibraltar
Description: LNG floating storage has been increasing to unprecedented levels in the south of Spain since September and volumes further increased in October, Kpler data show. On Oct. 17, seven vessels were loitering outside Spain's Cadiz shipyard near the strait of Gibraltar, a convenient spot for vessels awaiting a buyer’s call in southern Europe or northern Europe
Author: DE

Title: IEA expects 2022 global consumption to fall driven by European cuts
Description: Global gas consumption will drop by just short of 40 bn m3 this year from 2021 levels, the International Energy Agency forecasts. European consumption will lead the downward trend with a cut of at least 50 bn m3, mostly in the residential and commercial sector and the industry, as most of Europe aims to cut demand to pass the winter without most of its usual Russian pipeline supplies
Author: DE

Title: Gazprom warns it will stop supplying the EU if there is a gas price cap
Description: Russian gas producer Gazprom warned that it would stop supplying the EU if the bloc imposed a price cap on Russian gas. The EU Commission will present this week measures to stabilise unsustainable energy prices on its territory as the bloc faces an unprecedented gas shortage. A price cap on all EU gas imports including Russian piped gas and LNG is among these measures
Author: DE

Title: Chinese LNG demand for winter likely to be opportunistic despite enquiries
Description: A few LNG cargo purchases last week by a Chinese state-owned firm have led to questions as to whether China’s LNG demand may ramp up this winter, with these coming on the back of enquiries for supply by another Chinese state-owned firm last week.
Author: CK
